newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: European bunkers weaken with softer crude.
newsitem.headline: European bunkers weaken with softer crude.

text.p: Rotterdam bunker prices weakened on Tuesday as crude fell in a slow restart to trading after the Easter break.
Rotterdam 380 CST bunkers dropped by around $2 a tonne to $87/$88 fob as barges fell to as low as $85.
The weakness was largely a response to the falling crude price, but also reflected the very limited volume of demand.
Two large ship operators gave majors something to compete for, but independents had only a few small enquiries to meet.
Hamburg prices were similarly weak, falling by $1/$2 to around $92 fob.
Mediterranean fuel oil bunkers also lost, falling by up to $3 a tonne. Few suppliers reported much business, except in Spain.
One Spanish supplier said a few shorts had developed over the extended holiday weekend.
Fujairah fuel oil dipped by $1/$2 a tonne.
